ygData.subject: Re: CHAR vs WIS vs INT .......STOP THE INSANIT Y!!!!
ygData.msgSnippet: When you create an Enchanter, your two main attributes are Charisma and Intelligence. They are highlighted green indicating the most import attributes for the
ygData.messageBody:
When you create an Enchanter, your two main attributes are Charisma and
Intelligence. They are highlighted green indicating the most import
attributes for the Enchanter.

When I created my High Elf, I max'd out my INT and dumped the rest into
CHA. I had not played an Enchanter so I wasn't sure how else to split
the stats. I have another character at 16th level in which I did NOT
max out the two main stats because I had played this type of character
in beta and knew I needed some extra points in other attributes.

-----Original Message-----
From: Brian Bevier [mailto:BB34516@...]
Sent: Wednesday, April 21, 1999 3:01 PM
To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
Subject: [eqenchanters] Re: CHAR vs WIS vs INT .......STOP THE
INSANITY!!!!


From: Brian Bevier <BB34516@...>

Just one last comment that many people have seemed to have missed....
CHA
effect many of the charm based spells yes that is true, the thing you
all
are forgeting is that many of enchanter spells even if not named CHARM
spell
are charm based, meaning that CHARISMA does have an effect on them,
which
spells fall under this catagory I am not sure but I have talked to a few
GM
and they have stated that many of our spells fall under this catagory.

Leaokk
-----Original Message-----
From: Magik <aarongb@...>
To: eqenchanters@onelist.com <eqenchanters@onelist.com>
Date: Wednesday, April 21, 1999 2:21 PM
Subject: [eqenchanters] CHAR vs WIS vs INT .......STOP THE INSANITY!!!!


>From: "Magik" <aarongb@...>
>
>well I hate to agree with sumone that is so definate but.......
>
> I have been playing since beta4 and have freinds that have been
in
>since phase 3......even Stratics and the EQVault (which are authored by
beta
>testers!!!) tell us that charisma is the direct effect of merchant
>sales.......the debates you are talking about are obviously on webpages
that
>are NEWER or are made by ppl who are just lrearning the game and are
made
>based on assumtions of ingame actions......if you read EQSS and find
out
>what they say....... I quote straigth from the ATTRIBUTE section on the
left
>hand side of the website......this is cut and copied for all you NON
>belivers!!! if you ppl will notice that ONLY the charm spell is
effected
>by CHARISMA!!!!........the ***"CHARM" LINE OF SPELLS
ONLY***!!!!>........
>
>
> STRAIGHT FROM STRATICS ATRIBUTE PAGE!!!! eqss.stratics.com
>"WISDOM (Mana for Priests, Resistance to Mind Spells, Tertiary Skill
Check)
>WIS is the mana determinant for the priestly casters, and their derived
>hybrids (Cleric, Shaman, Druid, Ranger, Paladin). It is bar none the
most
>important stat for the former three classes and a consideration for the
>latter two. This attribute also affects your character's resistance
against
>mind-affecting spells, such as Charm. In addition, WIS provides a last
>chance to succeed at a failed skill roll. Although INT is the secondary
>skill-up attribute for most skills, WIS may grant you to continue a
failed
>skill roll. Minimal as the chance may be, it is still the opportunity
to
>succeed on a roll one has already failed via skill check.
>
>
>INTELLIGENCE (Mana for Mages, Skill Gain)
>INT is the mana determinant for the non-priestly casters (Wizard,
Enchanter,
>Magician, Necromancer), their derived hybrid (Shadowknight), and also
>determines how quickly one will gain skills. As such, it is important
to
all
>classes, but is especially so for the four non-priestly casters.
>
>
>CHARISMA (Faction Standing, Merchant Prices, Charm Success)
>CHA affects NPC prices--when both buying and selling--and also how NPCs
will
>react to you. While generally not a stat that most people raise, saving
some
>hard-earned platinum on that plate breastplate is always a nice bonus.
Also,
>CHA is almost the INT of faction. By having high CHA, you reduce the
amount
>of faction you need to have NPCs change their view toward you. This can
be
a
>nice bonus when questing. It is also a factor for Charm spells, which
>notably affects the enchanter.
>
>
>
> OK so can we put this to rest until more thourough and
>conclusive information can be posted or studied?......please ppl we
need
sum
>new topics.......
>
>
>
>Neurosiz
>
